publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-730# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Islay Creamery—That the Parliament expresses concern at the closure of the creamery on Islay and agrees that there should be a thorough investigation into the impact of the closure on the local economy and into what measures can be taken to assist in the creation of new job opportunities on the island. R
S1M-730# Islay Creamery (lodged on 31 March 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-730# Islay Creamery (lodged on 31 March 2000) Nick Johnston*
S1M-730# Islay Creamery (lodged on 31 March 2000) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Fergus Ewing*, David Mundell*, Bill Aitken*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S1M-730# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Islay Creamery—That the Parliament expresses concern at the closure of the creamery on Islay and agrees that there should be a thorough investigation into the impact of the closure on the local economy and into what measures can be taken to assist in the creation of new job opportunities on the island. R Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Nick Johnston, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Fergus Ewing, David Mundell, Bill Aitken, Mrs Margaret Ewing
S1M-730# Islay Creamery (lodged on 31 March 2000) Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-730# Islay Creamery (lodged on 31 March 2000) Mary Scanlon*, Mr Brian Monteith*

S1M-730# Mr Jamie McGrigor: Islay Creamery—That the Parliament expresses concern at the closure of the creamery on Islay and agrees that there should be a thorough investigation into the impact of the closure on the local economy and into what measures can be taken to assist in the creation of new job opportunities on the island. R Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Nick Johnston, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Fergus Ewing, David Mundell, Bill Aitken, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Mr Adam Ingram, Mary Scanlon, Mr Brian Monteith, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*
S1M-730# Islay Creamery (lodged on 31 March 2000) Alex Neil*
